Title: Translating CSR into managerial behavior: Determinants of charitable donation
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Spirals of spirituality: A qualitative study exploring patterns of spiritual organizing in Turkish organizations
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The pathways that make me committed: A dual-process model triggered by newcomer adjustment
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper proposes a dual-process model to explain how organizational socialization leads to newcomer commitment. We argue that cognitive and emotional pathways describe distinct psychological processes of socialization, leading to different types of commitment. Our findings strongly support that these pathways operate independent channels.
Index Keywords: Dual process; Independent channels; Psychological process; Social sciences

Title: Opportunities in the absorptive capacity construct: A metaanalysis to improve theoretical foundations and measures
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We integrate empirical findings in the relationships between ACAP and focal outcomes, and the effect of proxy choice on these relationships. Results show that ACAP is positively associated with focal outcomes, that proxy choice makes a difference and that surveys are more correlated to the organizational outcomes than archival measures.
Index Keywords: Absorptive capacity; Empirical findings; Meta-analysis; Organizational outcomes; Theoretical foundations

Title: Abusive supervision, justice, power distance, and employee deviance: A meta-Analysis
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We meta-Analytically examined the impact of abusive supervision on subordinate deviance, inclusive of the role of justice and power distance, using 43 independent sample studies (N = 12,035). Specifically, we investigated the mediating role of supervisory-And organizationally-focused justice and the moderating role of power distance as one model explaining why and when abusive supervision is related to subordinate deviance.
Index Keywords: Independent samples; Mediating roles; Meta analysis; Power distances

Title: An examination of the processes by which social accounts influence change
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Blacklisted benefactors: The political contestation of nonmarket strategy
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Community standards of deception
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: When is deception ethical? In this article, I develop and test a descriptive moral theory to shed light on this fundamental question. This research provides insight into how individuals value honesty and deception for making moral judgments, for learning information about themselves, and for communicating with others.
Index Keywords: Community standards; Moral judgment; Moral theory

Title: A dynamic double-hierarchy model of multicultural individuals' roles in culturally diverse teams
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: I present a theoretical model to describe the positive and negative roles multicultural team members can take in culturally diverse teams. I draw on social identity and faultline theories to explain how these roles impact team processes of information exchange, conflict and trust.
Index Keywords: Hierarchy models; Information exchanges; Multi-cultural teams; Social identity; Team process; Theoretical modeling

Title: Capitalizing on the co-operative business model to bolster paradoxical thinking in management education
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Mapping human resource management: A structural analysis of the field
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Using new mapping and clustering techniques, this article provides a structural review of Human Resource Management (HRM). Drawing on data from 7,376 articles, we present a rigorously developed term map (http://tiny.cc/ewxoux) visualizing five key HRM subfields. Through reviewing the clusters, we provide a bird's eye view of the field.
Index Keywords: Mapping; Natural resources management; Resource allocation; Bird's eye view; Clustering techniques; Subfields; Human resource management

Title: Incorporating effect size variation into meta-Analytic structural equation modeling
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Getting to zero: Goal setting to reduce blood stream infections
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We examine goal setting as a factor contributing to program outcomes in qualitative case studies of eight hospitals focused on preventing central line-Associated bloodstream infections (CLABSIs). We present a goal commitment framework that characterizes factors associated with successful CLABSI program outcomes.
Index Keywords: Blood streams; Goal commitments; Goal setting; Program outcomes; Qualitative case studies

Title: Successor CEO functional and educational background: Influence of predecessor characteristics and performance antecedents
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Information technology and innovation outputs: The missing link of search evolution
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Recent literature documents mixed findings on the impact of information technology (IT) investment on firm innovation outputs. We explain why firms with greater IT investment are more likely to search across boundaries in recombining knowledge, which has a curvilinear relationship with innovation outputs, and find empirical evidence corroborating our theory.
Index Keywords: Investments; Firm innovation; Information technology investments; IT investments; Innovation

Title: An investigation into silent coping by NGOS in third world countries
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper examines the conflation between silence and passivity of Third World development NGOs and shows that silence when used strategically creates local spaces of agency within overpowering constraints. The lack of visibility of these spaces at the global level acts towards preserving these spaces from getting further compromised.
Index Keywords: Local spaces; Third world; Third-world countries

Title: The moderating role of organizational context on learning-bydoing: Evidence from hospitals
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Origins and outcomes of strategy in nascent ecosystems
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Servant leadership, changes in personal values and job meaningfulness: A longitudinal study of organizational newcomers
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Bricolage, opportunity identification and corporate entrepreneurship: A subjectivist view
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Linking narcissism and business planning via self-efficacy and entrepreneurial orientation
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Critical learning and tempered radicalism: An exploration of the roles and development of early career academics
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Nomorepage3: Feminism and institutional work in corporate constructed arenas of citizenship
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Organization design and coordinating dirty work: Emergent practices as compensatory mechanisms for coordination
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The impact of international business education on career success: Evidence from Europe
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Factors influencing nascent entrepreneurship of the unemployed: The role of labor market policies
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Dealing with institutional complexity: Public procurement of management consulting services
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Charting the collective interest in collective entrepreneurship: An integrative review and framework for future research
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Our goal is to synthesize the vibrant yet disconnected conversations about collective entrepreneurship into a unified framework to facilitate the development of a more cohesive body of research. After offering a simple yet inclusive definition, we differentiate types of collective entrepreneurship by locus of entrepreneurial agency and primary basis for community.
Index Keywords: Unified framework

Title: Don't put me in that box!: Women leaders navigating identity asymmetries at work
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Dancing with the stars: The benefits of a star employee's temporary absence for firm performance
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: You cannot live of love alone -The interrelation of legitimacy and effectuation in nascent markets
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Public participation in budgeting: An empirical investigation of the tradeoff between inclusiveness and knowledgeability
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: The findings of this study support the argument that policymakers can pursue the democratic ideal of opening the policymaking door to the citizenry while still maintaining an active and efficient participatory process.
Index Keywords: Public policy; Empirical investigation; Participatory process; Policy makers; Policy making; Public participation; Budget control

Title: Multiunit chains, market competition, and product portfolio scope: Performance implications from the hospital industry
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Behavioral cycles leading to the divestment of previous core businesses
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Women don't mean business? Gender penalty in board appointments
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Business model change and network creation: Evidence from Berlin start-ups
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: A critical reading of the Eu's social innovation policy
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Who benefits from destructive creation?: Evidence from R & D investment after 9/11 attack
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: When brokerage is not enough: A multilevel investigation of middle managers' initiative
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Business education research: An identification and analysis of key clusters and themes
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper uses visual textual cluster analysis software to uncover key research themes from Arbaugh, Fornaciari, and Hwang's (2014) list of the 100 most cited business education articles. The findings will help scholars understand questions that drive the domain's research interests to further legitimacy and maturity.
Index Keywords: Analysis softwares; Business educations; Research interests; Cluster analysis

Title: Equity sensitivity versus egoism: New conceptualizations and implications for justice perceptions
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: The traditional definition of equity sensitivity?a preference for increased work rewards / reduced work inputs?is consistent with the notion of egoism, not equity sensitivity. We redefine equity sensitivity as a dispositional tendency to perceive stimuli as fair versus unfair; and we develop a Neutral Objects Fairness Orientation (NOFO) questionnaire.

Title: CSR motive attributions: The roles of executive leadership ethics and consumer cynicism
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: To date, there is limited research on whether CEOs influence consumer attributions of corporate motives for engaging in corporate-social-responsibility (CSR). Here, we propose and find support for the effect of CEO leadership ethics on consumer support for a firm's CSR. These effects were mediated by CSR motive attributions and cynicism respectively.
Index Keywords: Consumer support; Corporate social responsibilities (CSR); Philosophical aspects

Title: Organizational identity work in an emerging peer-To-peer (p2p) network
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Understanding resource-deprived actors' interaction with conflicting institutional demands
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Public trust's duality in the corporate social performance - Reputation - Financial performance relationship across countries
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: A balancing act: How to avoid professional disidentification when faced with stakeholder critique
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Based on 148 interviews with European police officers, we explore the role of negative external stakeholder feedback in shaping professional identities. We find that attributional processes act as a buffer against external critique, allowing individuals to maintain positive perceptions of their profession and avoid disidentification. We discuss the implications of these findings for multi-level outcomes, including stakeholder relations and organizational learning.
Index Keywords: External stakeholders; Multilevels; Organizational learning; Police officers; Professional identity; Law enforcement

Title: Leadership development practices and organizational outcomes
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Looking beyond the trees: A meta-Analysis and integration of voluntary turnover research
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We conducted a comprehensive meta-Analytic review of the voluntary turnover literature, while also testing a meta-Analytic path model connecting distal antecedents to turnover via multiple mediators. Results supported the powerful role of withdrawal cognitions in explaining the relationship between the predictors of turnover and exit.
Index Keywords: Meta analysis; Path models

Title: Understanding translation work in the multi-organizational translation of ideas
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper uses data from a longitudinal trans-national study to explore the multiorganizational translation of ideas. In examining the translation of a particular learning initiative over a seven year period, we identify and explicate the concept of translation work and how the nature of such translation work changes over time.
Index Keywords: Learning initiatives; Trans nationals

Title: Responding to complexity within a state logic: Environmental responsibility reporting in China
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We explored complexity within the Chinese government's dominant state logic. Drawing on panel data and interviews, we examined the multifaceted state influence on environmental reporting by Chinese listed firms. Results show that the state logic differentially impacts corporate environmental reporting, contingent on the government's hierarchical levels and policy instruments.
Index Keywords: Chinese Government; Environmental reporting; Environmental responsibility; Hierarchical level; Panel data; Policy instruments; Computer circuits

Title: How informational injustice leads to exit intentions: Cynicism in highly identified employees
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: From farms to fuel tanks: Differential effects of collective action on firm entry in the emergent U.S. Biodiesel sector
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The timing of training effects: A learning curve perspective
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This conceptual study examines how, when, and why the timing of training effects differs across types of training. Trainings inducing learning curve shift are associated with longer lag effects and a longer effect duration than trainings inducing learning curve acceleration. Constituting HRM investments, these trainings require corporate governance attention.
Index Keywords: Timing circuits; Conceptual study; Corporate governance; Lag effects; Learning curves; Training effects; Education

Title: Hybrid governance and property rights: A formal model
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: What do we know about nonprofit collaboration? A comprehensive systematic review of the literature
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper reports on a comprehensive literature review and coded analysis of prior research on nonprofit collaboration. Among 354 research articles, six themes emerge, including observations on the rich diversity of the scholarship but concerns about lack of scholarly attention to collaborative processes and the quality of analytic techniques.
Index Keywords: Analytic technique; Collaborative process; Literature reviews; Systematic Review

Title: Dynamic capabilities and top management team cognitions
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Incivility breeds civility? Effect of customer mistreatment on employees' daily helping behavior
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Using two samples of service workers from different industries, daily occurrence of customer mistreatment has a positive effect on employees helping behaviors displayed on the next day. Furthermore, this effect is mediated by employees' fluctuation in negative mood.
Index Keywords: Effect on employees

Title: From common ground to breaking new ground: Founding teams' prior shared experience and start-up performance
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The snowflake state: An investigation into entitlement as a state construct
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The effect of system-embedded visual restrictiveness on experience sharing
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This study investigates the effects of system-embedded visual restrictiveness on experience sharing in small groups. The results indicate a positive impact of a medium level of visual restrictiveness on experience sharing effectiveness and efficiency, mediated by the perceived faithfulness of appropriation of the interactive graphical template.
Index Keywords: Effectiveness and efficiencies; Experience sharing; Graphical template

Title: Tranformational leadership and emotion: A multilevel model of managing emotions in organizational identity change
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Management and income inequality: A reviewand theoretical model
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: As a field of scholarly inquiry, management has the potential to contribute in significant ways to our understanding of recent inequality trends. We review and assess recent research and then delineate a theoretical model that highlights the mechanisms through which business practice (and, indirectly, business pedagogy and scholarship) is linked to income inequality.
Index Keywords: Business practices; Income inequality; Recent researches; Theoretical modeling

Title: Internationalizing entrepreneurs: Bridging real options reasoning and affordable loss logics
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Through a transaction-level analysis of 1,040 small businesses from 52 countries, we develop and test a framework wherein export-minded entrepreneurs pair affordable loss logics with real options reasoning to internationalize more quickly and profitably than those who employ either or neither in strategic direction under conditions of irreducible uncertainty.
Index Keywords: Real Options; Small business; Strategic direction; Transaction level; Uncertainty analysis

Title: The effect of culture on expatriate deployment levels: Cultural distance and tightness-looseness
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: A multilevel study on antecedents of abusive supervision: A trait activation approach
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Drawing on the interactionist principle of trait activation and research relating personality traits and organizational contexts to abusive supervision, we develop and test a multilevel model that explains how supervisor trait anger interacts with trait relevant situational cues in affecting abusive supervision. Time-lagged data collected from subordinates and their immediate supervisors in 99 work teams supported our hypotheses.
Index Keywords: Regression analysis; Supervisory personnel; Activation approaches; Multilevel model; Organizational context; Personality traits; Work team; Chemical activation

Title: Internationalization through exaptation: The role of domestic geographical dispersion in the internationalization process
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The spiral of abuse...: Reciprocal relationships among abusive supervision, subordinate performance, and supervisor motives
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The organization made us do it: Demanding formalization and workaround attributions
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The dark side of brokerage: Conflicts between individual and collective pursuits of innovation
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Benefiting others at work as a drive: Job prosocial impact and employee proactive work behavior
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Institutional change and firms' entry mode in Africa
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Uncovering curvilinearity in organizational tenure-job performance relationship: Moderation effects of motivational job characteristics
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Value-based management sophistication in Europe - Organizational fit under institutional differences
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The evaluation of a gamification platform for business education
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We piloted an educational gamification platform and evaluated its motivational influence. Eighty-Two percent reported that it was "more" or "much more" motivating. Four themes contributed to student motivation: (1) Tracking one's own progress; (2) Comparing one's progress to others; (3) Having control over one's schedule; and (4) Improving performance.
Index Keywords: Business educations; Gamification; Improving performance; Student motivation; Motivation

Title: To err is human: A model of interorganizational violations and repair
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Do socially responsible firms appoint women and minority CEOS?
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: To address the lack of women and minorities in CEO positions, we adopt the institutional and stakeholder perspectives and propose that CSR engagement may facilitate the establishment of organizational-level institutional logics favoring diversity, subsequently motivating firms to appoint women and minorities to CEO positions. This relationship, however, is subjected to other economic, organizational, and social environmental influences.
Index Keywords: Environmental influences; Institutional logic; Organizational levels

Title: Identified ambivalence: When cognitive conflicts can help individuals overcome cognitive traps
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We investigate the functional effects of ambivalence on decision-making processes. We build on social cognition theory to propose that individuals who can identify the causes of their ambivalence engage in cognitive processes that counteract the well-documented adverse coping and defensive mechanisms associated with the dysfunctional outcomes of ambivalence.
Index Keywords: Cognitive process; Decision making process; Defensive mechanism; Social cognition theory

Title: Learning from outsourcing: The effects of outsourcing strategy on organizational efficiency
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Enacting social and commercial logics in issue selling
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We articulate how issue sellers engage social and commercial logics in order to advance social issues in for-profit organizations. We advance understanding on selling mechanisms by proposing how sellers undertake diagnostic, prognostic, and motivational framing tasks, and how these tasks draw on the logic composite of organizations and selling targets.
Index Keywords: Issue selling; Social issues; Sales

Title: Internal institutional contexts, leadership and, researchers' entrepreneurial intentions
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Drawing on institutional theory and applying a multi-level approach, the present research reveals that researchers' entrepreneurial intentions depend on the extent to which a research organization's internal institutional context reflects a commercialization-oriented logic. It shows that this contextual effect is mediated by two distinct aspects of research group leaders' behavior.
Index Keywords: Contextual effects; Institutional contexts; Institutional theory; Multilevels; Research groups; Research organization; Societies and institutions

Title: Expertise-As-performance: Dealing with the learning-credibility tension in management consulting
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The impact of handoffs on patient safety perceptions: Evidence from HSOPS
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Clinical handoff is the transition of patient care from one provider to another. We found that transfers of patient information, personal responsibility, and unit accountability are positively related to perceptions of patient safety and the former were influenced by communication culture, teamwork within and across units, and reporting culture.
Index Keywords: Patient care; Patient information; Patient safety; Personal responsibility; Reporting cultures

Title: Global diversification discount and its discontents: A bit of self-selection makes a world of difference
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Cooperation or competition? Gender stereotyping and interaction within female duos
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Proxy advisors as gatekeepers of shareholder dissent: A cross-national investigation of influence and effectiveness
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Proxy advisors are information intermediaries that provide voting recommendations to shareholders. Drawing on agency theory and the comparative corporate governance literature, we find that firm internal monitoring mechanisms substitute for proxy advice, and that proxy advice is less influential and has a lower predictive quality in relationship-based corporate governance contexts.
Index Keywords: Industrial management; Agency theory; Corporate governance; Cross-national; Monitoring mechanisms; Shareholders

Title: To matter or not matter? An overlooked key challenge for transition to retirement
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper focuses on the particular role of mattering, that is, individuals' perceptions that they matter to others, as a critical self-image dimension that may mediate social resources' impact on retirement planning and adjustment quality. Our results suggest that this is the case for retirees, but not older workers.
Index Keywords: Older workers; Retirement planning; Social resources

Title: Stamps of power and conflict: Imprinting and influence in the U.S. Senate, 1973-2009
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We theorize that the gain or loss of power produces corresponding shifts in influence; however, these effects are contingent upon people's experiences with power and conflict at the time of organizational entry. We evaluate and find support for these propositions in analyses of the U.S. Senate from 1973 to 2009.

Title: General purpose technologies (GPTS) and the internationalization of corporate innovations - A cross-country analysis
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Our study suggests that the specialization of GPTs promotes the internationalization of innovations, especially those in the GPT-based industries. Moreover, in the countries in which local industries largely develop GPTs, the innovative activities tend to be taken by firms from a wider range of countries and industries.
Index Keywords: Corporate innovation; Cross-country analysis; General purpose technologies; Innovative activities

Title: Cross-cultural adjustment of female self-initiated expatriates: A longitudinal diary study
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Trust and team performance: A meta-Analysis of main effects, contingencies, and qualifiers
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Social entrepreneurs' rhetorical strategies
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: On the strategic use of range offers in negotiations
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: When negotiators use range offers, they tend to construct ranges that are more conservative than others' single-value offers. As a consequence, range offers solicit less desirable counteroffers and lead to poorer outcomes than single-value offers. Range offers do not generate more integrative deals or increase the number of interested parties.
Index Keywords: Single-value

Title: How multiple accountabilities and means-end decoupling influence role ambiguity and job satisfaction
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper analyzes the individual level consequences of potentially conflicting accountability demands and of practices that are perceived as ineffective by organizational actors (means-end decoupling). When actors do not see how organizational practices are linked with intended outcomes, then this will result in higher role ambiguity and lower job satisfaction.
Index Keywords: Individual levels; Means ends; Organizational actors; Organizational practices; Role ambiguities; Job satisfaction

Title: Workplace victimization and general health: A mediated moderation model
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Drawing on the job demands-resources model, this study investigates how perceived leadership support can buffer the effects of role ambiguity on employee victimization. Using a sample of 2,067 employees, the findings reveal that perceived support from leaders moderates the mediated relationship between role ambiguity, workplace victimization, and general health.
Index Keywords: Job demands; Role ambiguities; Crime

Title: Can new business ventures compete with established suppliers? An investigation of the liability of newness in supplier selection
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Information asymmetry and acquirer returns: Dual effect of venture capital affiliation
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Board human capital, business expertise and the performance of public service organizations
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Whom should a leader imitate in multiple competitor settings? A contingency perspective
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Underlying mechanics of a succession dance: Predecessor preferences, human capital, and ownership
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Prolonged predecessor activity is common following family firm CEO successions. However, drivers of prolonged activity remain underresearched. Relying on the resource-based view and behavioral agency theory in conjunction, we analyze the "succession dance" from a human capital, ownership transition, and predecessor preference perspective in 804 German family business successions.
Index Keywords: Agency theory; Family business; Family firms; Human capitals; Resource-based view

Title: Revival of the alternative bivariate model of self-monitoring
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: The conventional univariate model of self-monitoring has reigned as the dominant interpretative paradigm in the literature for 40 years. However, recent findings associated with an alternative bivariate model challenge the conventional paradigm. I present 4 pieces of evidence supporting the alternative bivariate model, and their implications for measurement and theory.
Index Keywords: Bivariate models; Self-monitoring; Univariate models

Title: Prospective sense making: Strategy-making in a pioneering firm
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Middle managers' role in implementing innovative practices in VA: Lessons learned from the field
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Middle managers play key roles in hospitals as the bridge between senior leaders and frontline staff. Yet relatively little research has focused on their role in implementing new practices. This study expands the understanding of middle managers' influence in organizations by looking at their activities through the lens of two complementary conceptual frameworks.
Index Keywords: Managers; Conceptual frameworks; Front-line staffs; Innovative practices; Middle managers; Through the lens; Human resource management

Title: Discordant voices: How proteges grow in the context of developmental networks
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Entrepreneurial networking under uncertainty: An effectual Lens
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Balancing "what matters to me" & "what matters to them" in entrepreneurs' legitimation efforts
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Existing research has explained which activities entrepreneurs engage in to secure legitimacy but lacks understanding of how the process unfolds for the entrepreneur and how the entrepreneur's values and beliefs are implicated therein. On the basis of our study we present a process model to explain how environmental entrepreneurs figure out how to navigate the complex and uncertain legitimation process.
Index Keywords: Process Modeling; Values and beliefs

Title: Does entrepreneurial experience affect risk and ambiguity attitudes? An experimental study
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We present an experiment investigating ambiguity attitudes of entrepreneurs and nonentrepreneurs evaluating entrepreneurial projects. The results, consistent with prospect theory, show that entrepreneurs are ambiguity averse, but exhibit systematically more optimism than non-entrepreneurs, who are ambiguity neutral. Ambiguity aversion decreases with entrepreneurial experience and serial entrepreneurs are more optimistic than novice entrepreneurs.
Index Keywords: Ambiguity attitude; Ambiguity averse; Ambiguity aversion; Entrepreneurial project; Prospect theory

Title: Cognitive-motivational work orientations and follower preferences for transformational leadership
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The antecedents of engaged in team leadership: A leader-member interaction perspective
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Creative agreements in negotiation: When and why negotiators redefine the issues under discussion
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Why silence is golden: Firm participation in social media in an IPO context
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Letting the chosen ones know: The psychological effects of talent status self-Awareness
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Uncertainty, adaptation, and alliance performance
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Alliance adaptation refers to a bundle of governance-based change practices in ongoing alliances. Based on the transaction cost perspective, we develop and test hypotheses on how changing environmental conditions and unpredictable partner actions trigger ex post governance adaptations in alliances, and how these adaptations in turn affect alliance performance.
Index Keywords: Alliance performance; Environmental conditions; Transaction cost

Title: Corporate social performance and CEO dismissal: An empirical investigation
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: They are your testimony: Clients, professionals and promotions in professional service firms
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Self-esteem and women's performance in mixed-gender negotiations
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Existing research shows that women may experience stereotype threat in mixed-gender negotiations. However, little is known about the boundary conditions of this effect. In this research we found a negative interaction effect of self-esteem level × social contingent selfesteem in the stereotype threat condition. We discuss the associated theoretical implications.
Index Keywords: Negative interaction; Self esteem; Stereotype threat

Title: Earnings pressure and corporate philanthropy: The influence of security analysts and foreign exposure
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The relationship between job resources, work engagement, and employee proactivity: Does job fit make a difference?
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Organizational identity and resistance to environmental pressures
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Organizations as internal value creators: Toward a typology of value within organizations
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The social value of information technology: How it investments enhance hospital reputation
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We examine mediating mechanisms linking IT investments and organizational reputation based on panel data from 153 English hospitals. Reputation is measured using 155,084 newspaper articles. Findings show that changes in IT investments are associated with subsequent changes in media reputation. Importantly, the direct reputation-enhancing effect of IT persists even when accounting for hospital effectiveness, efficiency, and external reporting.
Index Keywords: Hospitals; Enhancing effect; IT investments; Panel data; Social values; Investments

Title: Riding off into the sunset: Shareholder reactions to CEO retirements
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Constructive deviance as a planned behavior
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Top management team attributes, bricolage and ambidexterity in small and medium-sized enterprises
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Continuous improvement: The influence of high performance work systems, work climate, and collectivism
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The effects of cosmopolitan culture, competitiveness, and need for cognitive closure on creativity
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Corporate management practices to integrate sustainability into sourcing: A taxonomy of firms
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: A conceptual model of territory management among groups in organizations
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Entry mode and performance of nordic firms: Firm-specific advantages and international experience
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: I suggest that the association between foreign market equity entries and firm-specific assets (FSAs) built through international experience diminishes as firms build FSA through firm size. Using data on Nordic firms, I find that firms whose entry mode can be predicted by such a model yield higher post-entry performance.
Index Keywords: Entry mode; Firm size; Foreign markets; International experiences; Model yields; Nordic firms

Title: Sensemaking, schema interaction dynamics, and corporate environmental performance
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The case method as invented tradition: Revisiting Harvard's history to reorient management education
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Support for the case method reflects a conviction that business education should be training in solving business problems. However, opponents see it as contributing to a narrow, instrumental, amoral perspective on business. We revisit the emergence of the method at Harvard to think beyond this polarization for the future.
Index Keywords: Business educations; Business problems; Case method; Harvard; Management education

Title: An empirical examination of e-learning design: The role of trainee socialization and complextiy in short term training
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This study examined how the use of a pre-Training socialization activity and task complexity affected e-learning outcomes. Results indicated that those who received face-To-face socialization outperformed those who received either online socialization or no socialization. Those who received simpler training outperformed those who received more complex training. Implications are discussed.
Index Keywords: E-learning; Education; E-learning design; Empirical examination; Face to face; Pre-training; Short term; Task complexity; Social sciences

Title: I am a farmer or a worker? Explore why migrant workers quit from an identity strain perspective
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This study adopts an identity strain perspective to understand migrant workers' turnover. We found that migrant workers' identity strain had a positive impact on turnover, and supervisory support climate, serving as a type of job resource, buffered this effect. The interacting effects of identity strain and supervisory support climate on turnover was mediated by adjustment.
Index Keywords: Job resources; Migrant workers

Title: Shooting for the moon? Relationships between corporate environmental aspirations and achivements
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Patenting behavior by academic entrepreneurs: The role of the organizational regime
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: The proceedings contain 271 papers. The topics discussed include: the entrepreneurship industry: influences of the goods and services marketed to entrepreneurs; internationalizing entrepreneurs: bridging real options reasoning and affordable loss logics; disharmony in new harmony: insights from the narcissistic leadership of Robert Owen; management in the Portsmouth block mill, 1803-1812; analyzing motivational determinants of knowledge-sharing in enterprise social media platforms'; what passes as a transparent field study in management?; incivility breeds civility? effect of customer mistreatment on employees' daily helping behavior; and identified ambivalence: when cognitive conflicts can help individuals overcome cognitive traps.

Title: Over the top of the hill: Sensemaking and the role of meetings in sustaining strategic change
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Intergenerational learning in organizations: A temporal-dynamic view on age-mixed training groups
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This study examines learning in a full-Time qualification course with young and experienced participants. Data from 31 interviews over a span of three years reveal that both generations possess distinct types of knowledge. I develop a dynamic model of intergenerational learning involving three phases: Familiarization, Assimilation and Detachment.
Index Keywords: Temporal dynamics; Three phasis; Education

Title: Government corruption and foreign invested firms' bribery, resources, and perforamnce in least developed countries: An interactive approach
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper aims to identify the interactive mechanisms between government corruption, foreign invested firm (FIF) resources, bribery strategy, and performance in least developed countries (LDCs). A key finding is that developing country FIFs experience a positive corruption-performance relationship via bribery, while developed country FIFs achieve good performance through refusing bribery.
Index Keywords: Developing countries; Developed countries; Interactive approach; Least-developed countries; Crime

Title: Product liability crises and R & D alliances: Which governance mode minimizes negative spillovers?
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Analyzing motivational determinants of knowledge-sharing in enterprise social media platforms
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: What founders in developing countries learn about organizing microenterprise growth
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This study draws on nine cases of microenterprise growth in Tanzania to investigate what microenterprise founders learn from organizational process experience. The findings lead to a set of propositions about founders' learning in opportunity-rich, growth-constrained environments, and are integrated into a discussion of microenterprise growth challenges.
Index Keywords: Developing countries; Organizational process; Tanzania; Education

Title: Exploring the institutionalization of corporate responsibility: A formal modeling approach
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: To go fast, go slow: The effect of phase durations on team perfo rmance trajectories in trial-And-error experimentation
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We examined how time allocated to action and transition phases affected the trial-Anderror experimentation process in groups. Groups that were given shorter action phases followed by longer transition phases discussed more errors, and produced steeper performance trajectories, which led to more positive group atmospheres, improved coordination, and better final outcomes.
Index Keywords: Phase duration; Transition phasis; Trial and error

Title: Through the looking glass: Surveillance, resistance and the recreation of workplace identity
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The contingent spillovers of wrongdoing: Differential reactions by stakeholders in the wake of organizational wrongdoings
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Risk, uncertainty and entrepreneurship: Evidence from a lab-in-The-field experiment
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We study risk attitudes of entrepreneurs, managers and employees (n = 2,288). The results indicate that entrepreneurs are only unique in their lower degree of loss aversion and not in their risk or ambiguity aversion. We further show that loss aversion can partly explain the current mixed evidence.
Index Keywords: Behavioral research; Ambiguity aversion; Field experiment; Loss aversion; Risk attitude; Human resource management

Title: Workplace ostracism and employee performance outcomes: The pragmatic and psychological effects
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Using supervisor-subordinate dyads data from two large companies in different industries with a multi-source, multi-wave design, we find that workplace ostracism influences job performance and creativity through access to information, access to resources, and intrinsic motivation. In addition, as a stress-buffering mechanism, perceived organizational support plays a key role in neutralizing the negative impacts of workplace ostracism.
Index Keywords: Access to resources; Buffering mechanisms; Employee performance; Intrinsic motivation; Job performance; Large companies; Perceived organizational supports; Psychological effects

Title: The strength-of-weak-Ties hypothesis in China revisited: Evidence from within-individual fixed-effects models
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Scholars contend that the strength-of-weak-Ties hypothesis (SWT) does not hold in China. Using data on 605 Chinese college graduates searching for jobs, we find that while the conventional approach finds no support for SWT, the within-individual fixed-effects approach finds evidence consistent with SWT.
Index Keywords: College graduates; Conventional approach; Fixed effects; Weak ties

Title: Product diversity, category emergence, and legitimacy: Evidence from the early American classical and jazz recordings
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The strength to face the facts: Self-regulation defends against defensive information processing
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Five studies examined the impact of self-regulatory resources on defensive information processing, or the tendency to deny, distort, or avoid self-Threatening (but informative) information. People low in trait and state self-regulatory capacities demonstrated more defensive processing. For participants with an active self-improvement motive, reduced self-regulatory resources did not affect defensive processing.
Index Keywords: Self regulation

Title: Safety climate antecedents on safety management effectiveness at mitigating harm and loss: The mediating role of management commitment to safety
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: The present research investigates the interplay between different facets of safety climate. We show that the relationship between training, procedures, and work pressure on safety effectiveness is partly mediated by management commitment (study 1), conditional on co-worker disengagement (study 2). Worker sensemaking regarding safety is management-centric blameoriented (study 3).
Index Keywords: Human resource management; IS managements; Management commitment to safeties; Mediating roles; Safety climate; Safety management; Sensemaking; Work pressures; Occupational risks

Title: The behavioral ethics of deontology and utilitarianism: Are they as separable as they seem?
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Managing high-potential employees in MNCS: The mediating role of socialization mechanisms
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Leadership and sustainability: A systematic assessment of the empirical evidence
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper consolidates the empirical research to date on the relationship between leadership and sustainability. We conduct a comprehensive, systematic and narrative review of all published quantitative studies that examine the link between leadership and sustainability broadly defined, and put forward an integrative model encapsulating current knowledge.
Index Keywords: Empirical research; Integrative modeling; Quantitative study; Systematic assessment; Sustainable development

Title: Under pressure: The causal effect of financial analyst coverage on long-Term capital investments
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This study examines whether coverage from financial analysts causes corporate shorttermism by affecting the horizons of firms' capital investments. I hypothesize and empirically illustrate that greater analyst coverage leads to more pressure on managers to perform in the short term, which biases firms away from making longer-Term capital investments.
Index Keywords: Analyst coverages; Capital investment; Financial analysts; Short term; Investments

Title: Exploration, adaptation and expression: Women's identity work across career and family transitions
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Through an investigation of the narrative identity work of 35 professional/managerial women, three identity processes were uncovered. These processes illuminate how women construct, revise and present their identities over time as they transition from students to professionals, from non-mothers to mothers, and from childless employees to combining career and family.

Title: Macro-economic crises and corporate sustainability
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Relational evolution: The role of managerial commitment on collaborative transformation
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Extant research indicates firms struggle to achieve relational advantage. We provide insight into relational capabilities through a longitudinal inductive study. We find the nature of managerial commitment influence the transformation process and present a cognizancecommitment- capability perspective to explain why some companies make the collaborative transformation and others do not.
Index Keywords: Relational capabilities; Transformation process; Managers

Title: The social construction of scandal: The role of the media in the 2009 british parliamentary expense affair
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We investigate the role of media in shaping the evolution of meaning and its effect on Members of Parliament (MPs) resignations during the 2009 British Parliamentary Expense Scandal. We find support for media socially constructing the meaning of the scandal. MPs who are implicated centrally faced increased pressures to resign.
Index Keywords: Members of parliaments; Social constructions

Title: Here's an idea: Knowledge sharing among competitors to build a critical mass
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Leader-member social exchange process: The mediating roles of state gratitude and momentary trust in leader
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Drawing on the affect theory of social exchange, we develop and test a leader-member exchange process model that explains the momentary psychological mechanisms underlying exchange events that take place between leaders and members. Multilevel analyses of paired observations supported our hypotheses.
Index Keywords: Leader members; Leader-member exchanges; Mediating roles; Multi-level analysis; Social exchange; Trust in leaders

Title: Institutional constraints, managerial choices, and conflicts in public sector supply chains
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Building human capital advantage in initial public offerings (IPOS): Blending resource and attention-based views of the firm
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Investment horizon of institutional investors and financial restatement likelihood
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Building on insights from the recent literature in strategic management, I hypothesize a negative relationship between institutional investors' investment horizon and financial restatement likelihood. Results from a multi-year sample of 182 firms from Fortune 1000 firms provide empirical support for this prediction. CEO duality and outside director compensation structure do not moderate this relationship.
Index Keywords: Compensation structure; Financial restatements; Institutional investors; Investment horizon; Strategic management; Investments

Title: When do firms invest in developing rookies? A firm-level analysis of the decision to build versus acquire human capital
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper investigates a firm's decision to build or acquire its human capital. The results suggest that a firm that has the attributes to provide mentorship to its rookie employees and to pursue long-horizon investments are more likely to invest in developing rookies.
Index Keywords: Firm-level analysis; Human capitals

Title: How does dialogue really take place in a democratic transition?
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Entrepreneurial couples
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The embedding effect of transformational leadership in extreme contexts
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Implementing green supply chain practices: An empirical investigation in the shipbuilding industry
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This study analyses drivers for supply chain participation of suppliers in the shipbuilding industry. Hypotheses are tested, using data of 93 suppliers of leading shipbuilding companies. Supplier readiness, competitive advantage and social responsibility are found to be significant drivers. No significance was found for governmental regulations and customer requirements.
Index Keywords: Competition; Ships; Shipyards; Supply chains; Competitive advantage; Customer requirements; Empirical investigation; Governmental regulations; Green supply chain; Shipbuilding industry; Social responsibilities; Shipbuilding

Title: Which comes first? And how long? A study on people management and firm finanical performance
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: When do firms take their domestic M & A ownership patterns overseas?
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Pre-entry experience, post-entry organizational learning, and new entrants' performance
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Entrepreneurial skills or reward for success? Does entrepreneurship pay in future paid employment?
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Polluted work: A self-control perspective on air pollution
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Organizational governance and politics
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Board processes and CEo succession planning
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The (Under) performance of mega-projects: A metaorganizational perspective
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The rate of substitution between economic and socioemotional wealth in family firm IPO underpricing
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This study investigates differences in IPO underpricing between family and nonfamily firms. Using a sample of 1,743 IPOs occurring in seven European countries from 1995 to 2011, we show that the relationship between family firm status and IPO underpricing is contingent on the degree of share retention.
Index Keywords: European Countries; Family firms; IPO underpricing

Title: The consequences of expectations: A look at possible directions for repatriation research
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Measuring the family: Development of scales for the assessment of business-owning families
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Covenants not to compete: The ties that stifle productivity!
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: A lingering ambiance: Pre-retirement work context & the impact of retirement on drinking behavior
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Seeking to explain the varying effects of retirement on alcohol consumption, we propose a model that highlights the lingering implications of pre-retirement work climate. Our findings supported the proposed model, indicating that unit-level stress climate and descriptive drinking norms moderate the indirect effect of retirement, via distress, on alcohol consumption.
Index Keywords: Alcohol consumption; Indirect effects; Climate models

Title: Constructing leadership development: Pedagogies of women's and general leaderhsip development programs
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: From shame to fame: A model of the destigmatization process in media discourse
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Distressed and drained: Intimate partner aggression and the buffering role of supervisor support
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: A theory of reflexive appropriation of morality
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Strategic categorization: Managing categories by vertical and horizontal changes in self-categorization
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Desperately seeking fixedness: Practitioners accounts of becoming doctoral researchers
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Small, but attractive: The effect of employer branding and legitimacy on startup attractiveness
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Towards a social-practice theory of competition
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Doing well by doing good and by saying good
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The political role of business and democratic illegitimacy
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Do employee use a second opinion to assess and react to their own perception of discrimination? Evidence from vignette and field studies
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Objects of attention: Material artefacts and strategic issue sustaining over time
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The contingent value of managerial political ties in private debt financing: Evidence from Ghana
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This study examines the impact of managerial political ties on cost of debt. Using survey data, we find that political ties are positively related to interest rates. This relationship is weakened by managerial financial ties, and strengthened by borrowing from private-owned banks and the appointment of Big Four audit firms.
Index Keywords: Audit firms; Debt financing; Interest rates; Survey data; Managers

Title: Should birds of a feather flock together? Agglomeration-by-nationality trade-off in foreign markets
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: I examine how agglomeration-by-nationality affects firm behavior and performance in foreign markets. I argue that agglomeration-by-nationality poses a trade-off between exploitative and explorative innovation, and further explore behavioral mechanisms that explain how agglomeration-by-nationality impacts innovation. Using a sample of pharmaceutical firms in the U.S., I find support for my arguments.
Index Keywords: Behavioral mechanisms; Foreign markets; Pharmaceutical firms; Trade off; Agglomeration

Title: Selling strategy in cultural organizations: Museum guides in action
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper explores how workers in the public and non-profit sectors contribute to strategy. Using a workplace studies approach, we demonstrate the subtle and intricate work of museum tour guides: These workers skilfully combine language, material and bodily expressions in the flow of their everyday work to bring strategy into being.
Index Keywords: Museum guide; Non-profit; Selling strategies; Tour guide; Workplace studies

Title: Regulator leniency and mispricing in beneficent nonprofits
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We posit that nonprofits that provide more unprofitable services face lenient regulatory enforcement for mispricing. Consequently, beneficent nonprofits exploit such leniency and exhibit higher mispricing. Archival analyses using a hospital sample support our hypotheses. Our results suggest that lenient enforcement assists beneficent nonprofits to obtain higher revenues in price-regulated markets.
Index Keywords: Archival analysis; Costs

Title: Knowledge transfer in multilevel networks: Contingent effect of organizational and social structure
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We examine how organizational and social structure jointly influence knowledge transfer and sharing relations across organizational subunit boundaries. In an analysis of task advice relations among members of a Formula One team, we find that informal network mechanisms reinforce, complement and complete workflow dependencies implied by formal organizational structure.
Index Keywords: Information management; Formula One; Knowledge transfer; Multi-level networks; Network mechanism; Organizational structures; Social structure; Workflow dependency; Knowledge management

Title: Antecedents of added cultural distance: Towards an integrated, multi-Theoretical framework
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Whereas the extant literature has focused on the consequences of added cultural distance, our study is the first to explore its antecedents. Insights from the attention-based view and resource dependence theory complement a learning-based approach. We find that, besides an MNE's recombination capability and its degree of dispersion within the firm, home country policy and demand uncertainty tend to be strong determinants of added cultural distance, especially when the home market is important for the MNE.
Index Keywords: Attention-based views; Degree of dispersion; Demand uncertainty; Learning-based approach; Resource dependences; Theoretical framework

Title: From passion to alertness: An investigation of the mechanisms through which passion drives alertness
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This study investigates the motivational and self-regulatory antecedents of alertness (Kirzner, 1979) -A crucial component in the entrepreneurship process. Using data from 203 entrepreneurs in multiple industries, the study finds that passion acts as an indirect antecedent of alertness, with its effects mediated by proaction, learning goal orientation, and creativity.
Index Keywords: Learning goals; Digital storage

Title: Making social issues count: How businesses address social issues in strategic decision-making
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Shedding new light on the black box: High-performance work systems and proactivity
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Me versus us: Concealing high status identities from lower status peers
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The dependent effect of health it and hospital-physician integration on evidence based practices
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The role of non-reflexivity in facilitating and destabilizing organizational hybridity
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: A key constraint to conceptual blending - Examining two metalanguages of change
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Say when: A theory of peak social benefit
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Relationship between internationalization and innovation in emerging economy firms
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Emerging economy multinationals (EMNEs) are increasingly internationalizing their operations as well as moving away from imitation towards innovation. We study the relationship between internationalization and innovation activity of these EMEs. Data on 64 Indian biopharmaceutical firms from 1997 to 2013 is used to empirically test our hypotheses.
Index Keywords: Biopharmaceutical firms; Emerging economies; Innovation activity; Innovation in emerging economies

Title: Examining the mechanism behind work-To-family positive synergies; indirect and conditional effects of work engagement, gender, and boundary control
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Inside directors & mitigating underinvestment of financial slack in R & D-Intensive firms
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We revisit Jensen's Free Cash Flow hypothesis and investigate the influence inside directors have in the governance of managerial cash holdings, or financial slack, in high technology firms where R&D persistence is needed for sustained competitive advantage.
Index Keywords: Free cash flow; High technology firms; Sustained competitive advantages; Underinvestment; Competition

Title: Benchmarking the frequency, content, and efficacy of peer reporting policies
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Culture in politics: A dual-embeddedness approach to managerial political involvement
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: To better understand the manager's incentives in pursing political connections, this study extends the literature and proposes a dual-embeddedness approach to simultaneously consider both structural and cultural aspects of political connections; both instrumental and expressive use of political connections; and both collective and individual incentives of political connections.
Index Keywords: Managers; Cultural aspects; Embeddedness; Manager's incentives; Political Connections; Social sciences

Title: Management in the portsmouth block mill, 1803-1812
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: The Portsmouth Block Mills' operations are assessed using archival materials showing staff numbers, hours and work assignments, providing insight into scheduling and workload management, capacity availability and use, and overall facility organization and design. A review of production records reveals items made to meet individual production requirements and those made for "stock" and later use, and the Mill's internal lines ran in a relatively "lean" fashion.
Index Keywords: Scheduling; Archival materials; Production record; Production requirements; Work assignments; Workload management; Human resource management

Title: The entrepreneurship industry: Influences of the goods and services marketed to entrepreneurs
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper defines and demarcates the Entrepreneurship Industry (EI) and provides an empirical evaluation of EI's impact on the propensity and ability to take entrepreneurial action. Initial results indicate that while EI consumption drives higher rates of entrepreneurial activity it is also related to weaker operational performance and lower survival rates.
Index Keywords: Empirical evaluations; Entrepreneurial action; Entrepreneurial activity; Operational performance; Survival rate

Title: Making an impression with open strategy: Transparency and engagement on corporate blogs
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Toward an integrated theory of strategy
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We introduce the concepts of customer advantage, stakeholder advantage and economic surplus to develop an integrative approach to the study of strategic management. We develop a conceptual framework to analyze the interdependencies between competitive, growth and stakeholder strategies for the achievement of customer and stakeholder advantage.
Index Keywords: Conceptual frameworks; Economic surplus; Strategic management

Title: Translating poverty into profits: The nature and limits of collective identity as an editing lens for institutional complexity
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Social movements and market entry: A synthesis and extension
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The impact of storytelling on innovation: A multi case study
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We study the effect of storytelling within the family on family firm innovation. Based on a multi-case study of 41 Italian family wineries, we reveal that the shared stories affect decision making within the firm and ultimately innovation. We further show that the stories' content affects the level of innovation.
Index Keywords: Family firms; Level of innovation

Title: The power of one: How CEO power affects corporate environmental sustainability
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: The mechanisms underlying CEOs' influence over the board and the executive suite in pursuing environmental initiatives are not well understood. We discuss how CEO power based on environmental expertise and formal influence among executives and directors, in the absence and presence of shareholder activism, spurs firms towards greener strategies.
Index Keywords: Environmental initiatives; Environmental sustainability; Shareholder activisms; Sustainable development

Title: Evolution of venture capital syndicates over rounds: Who may be the newcomer?
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Social affiliations and performance of experts in organizations
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This paper investigates how social affiliations between experts and clients influence value creation and appropriation in transactions and firm performance. My novel approach pairs data from the Utahrealestate.com Multiple Listing Service with geographically-Assigned LDS (Mormon) church congregation boundary data. I find affiliations positively impact value creation, appropriation, and firm revenues.
Index Keywords: Boundary data; Firm Performance; Impact value; Multiple listing services; Value creation

Title: Impact of intensity of supervisor's mistreatment on employee attitudes
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Existing research generally believes that supervisory mistreatment leads to negative employee attitudes and behaviors. Drawing on the social learning theory, present study extends the content domain of supervisory mistreatment research by examining the conditional effect of power distance orientation on the relationship between intensity of supervisory mistreatment and employee attitudes.
Index Keywords: Conditional effects; Employee attitudes; Power distances; Social learning theory; Behavioral research

Title: The benefits of ambiguity: The emergence of the organizational category of social entrepreneurship
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: What passes as a transparent field study in management?
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Popular narcissists: Power dependence and social acceptance in the workplace
