Title: Do increases in R & D search intensity signal future performance problems? A behavioral theory perspective
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: CEOS, COOS, and cognition: Resolving a top management team conundrum
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Scholars disagree as to whether COOs help or harm firms. We argue that their usefulness depends on whether CEOs are abstract or concrete thinkers. In a study of technology firms, we find that the presence of a COO harms firm performance for abstract-Thinking CEOs yet boosts performance for concrete-Thinking CEOs.
Index Keywords: Concretes; Abstract thinking; Firm Performance; Top management teams; Human resource management

Title: On the front lines of disclosure: Unpacking the identity work of disclosure recipients in diverse workplaces
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We developed a framework that examines how the disclosure recipient's identity as a privileged person shapes their relational identification with the discloser and, in turn, results in a range of supportive to hostile responses. We propose that the disclosure recipient responses have important implications for the discloser's future disclosure decisions.

Title: Employees' micro-break activities and job performance: An examination of telemarketing employees
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: When suppliers climb the value chain: A theory of value distribution in vertical relationships
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Disciplined autonomy and innovation effectiveness: The role of team confidence and task volatility
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Structural effects of sex-ratios and power distribution on the survival rates of female monasteries
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We draw on Kanter's Token theory to analyze the relationship between sex proportions, the distribution of power and the survival chances of 4,606 Catholic monasteries over a period of 1,483 years. The hypotheses will be tested by survival analysis. We find partial support for the theoretical framework of Kanter.
Index Keywords: Power distributions; Sex ratios; Structural effect; Survival analysis; Survival rate; Theoretical framework

Title: Explaining unequal returns to social capital among entrepreneurs
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Beyond the motherhood penalty: Does degree of caregiving responsibility affect job discrimination?
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Examining the characteristics and challenges of professional services: A sector specific study of us consultancy
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We examine extant conceptualizations of professional services operations management (PSOM) using mixed-method data (semi-structured interview, focus group, and a best-worst choice experimental survey) collected from consultants in the US hospitality sector. Analysis supports the need for a more contingent perspective of PSOM, rather than the 'one-size-fits-All' model common today.
Index Keywords: Management science; Experimental survey; Focus groups; Mixed method; Operations management; Professional services; Semi structured interviews; Information management

Title: The effect of human capital renewal on organizational innovation over time
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: The ability to innovate is critical for organizations to develop sustainable competitive advantage. We posit that new hires' knowledge, skills, abilities, and other characteristics (KSAOs) are related to an organization's innovation, and this human capital renewal mechanism depends on the firm's processes and practices to integrate new hires' KSAOs.
Index Keywords: Competition; Human capitals; Organizational innovation; Sustainable competitive advantages; Societies and institutions

Title: Activist versus slacktivist: A dual path model of online protest mobilization
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Towards an open source software development life cycle: A study of routine heterogeneity and discourse across multiple releases
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We develop an Open Source Software (OSS) lifecycle model by conducting a longitudinal mixed method analysis of a medium-scale OSS project. We identify two forms of routines: discourse-driven and direct problem solving routines and trace their proportional distributions over time. We use these findings to propose an OSS lifecycle model.
Index Keywords: Computer software; Life cycle; Open systems; Software design; Software engineering; Direct problems; Life cycle model; Medium-scale; Mixed method; Multiple release; Open source software

Title: Responding to identity and reputation dissonance in a management consulting firm
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The influence of entry density on the survivability of SMEs in international markets
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Does representative bureacracy improve public service performance?: Evidence from an instrumental variable approach
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This study finds that an increase in the share of ethnic minority officers in a given force is associated with a decrease in the number of crimes in the area under the force's jurisdiction during the 10-year period.
Index Keywords: Ethnic minorities; Instrumental variables; Public services

Title: A meta-Analysis of group differences in the perception of workplace mistreatment
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Despite anecdotal reports that women/minorities experience greater workplace mistreatment, no meta-Analysis has examined subgroup differences in workplace mistreatment. The current study filled this gap by meta-Analyzing sex and race differences in perceived workplace mistreatment (e.g., harassment, discrimination, bullying) with results counterintuitively suggesting small differences in mistreatment across demographic groups.
Index Keywords: Demographic groups; Group differences; Meta analysis

Title: Incentives in third-party governance: Management practices and accountability implications
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Contract incentives are designed to motivate contractor performance and to provide public managers with a powerful tool to achieve contract accountability. This study assesses public managers' implementation of contract incentives in practice by creating a typology of contract incentives and exploring the factors that influence managerial use of incentives.
Index Keywords: Contractor performance; Management practices; Third parties; Managers

Title: Managerial struggles during practice implementation: The case of corporate social responsibility
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We examine the role of CSR managers as drivers of CSR practice implementation. Building on empirical data from MNCs we address the question of what happens within organizations when internal actors attempt to promote the implementation of social, environmental and ethical practices.
Index Keywords: Corporate social responsibilities (CSR); Empirical data; Ethical practices; Managers

Title: What happens when HRM practices foster work intensity?: Exploring the impact on employee outcomes
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The origin of capabilities? A microfoundational theory of firm heterogeneity
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Stakeholder engagement and organizational experiential learning: Evidence from M & A
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Impact of distractions on human newsvendor decisions -A laboratory investigation
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This study investigates the impact of presence of other tasks on the effectiveness of the distracted newsvendor's ordering decisions. We conduct experiments by manipulating level of cognitive load that the subjects face during newsvendor decision making. We find that distracted subjects tend to order less than those under non-distracted subjects.
Index Keywords: Cognitive loads; Laboratory investigations; Newsvendors

Title: Linkages among trust, monitoring & performance in interfirm relationships: A cross-national study
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Interfirm relationships characterized by higher emergent trust-based systems are expected to result in higher performance and require lower levels of monitoring. Using multi-group structural equation modeling, we evaluate this premise directly based on a cross-cultural sample from the US and Germany to examine whether such effects are universal versus culture-specific.
Index Keywords: Cross-national; Inter-firm relationships; Multi-group; Structural equation modeling; Trust-based systems

Title: Governing highly performing lean team behaviors: A mixed-methods longitudinal study
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: This inductive study focuses on behavioral and contextual predictors of sustainable lean team performance. Five lean work-floor teams were studied over three years, using objective performance data; surveys; (video-)observation; and retrospective interviews. We reveal a cascading effect: Top-And team-leader support for lean affects effective team behaviors.
Index Keywords: Cascading effects; Longitudinal study; Mixed method; Performance data; Team leaders; Team performance

Title: Effects of achievement and personal recognition events on state work engagement: A dual-path model
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Leading in academia: A curricular example for developing women scientists for leadership roles
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: A mixed-methods analysis of engagement driving leadership practices
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Corporate sustainable development in emerging-market multinational enterprises: Evidence from Taiwan
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: The social construction of a scapegoat: Deviation, sacrifice, repression and heroism in resistance
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Thinking together: Making communities of practice work
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Not just talking to the greenies: Testing a pro-environmental intervention based on increasing self-concordance
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: There is a clear need to change our energy use to mitigate climate change. Three studies supported the hypothesis that we can increase sustainable energy use by connecting it to goals that are important to a person, even if such goals are unrelated to climate change or the environment.
Index Keywords: Energy use; Sustainable energy use; Climate change

Title: Age-diverse training groups: How knowledge sharing and psychological safety promote individual learning outcomes
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: Perceived (but not objective) age diversity is negatively linked to learning in on-site industrial training groups. This relationship is mediated by knowledge sharing and moderated by psychological safety climate, such that the indirect negative effect of age diversity on learning through knowledge sharing occurs only when psychological safety is low.
Index Keywords: Information management; Knowledge management; Individual learning; Industrial training; Knowledge-sharing; Psychological safety; Education

Title: Moments of waking Up: A doorway to mindfulness and presence
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: People have tried for centuries to develop practices that bring them present to what is, in the moment-A transition we refer to as "waking up." This two-year collaborative action research project by 15 professionals explored how intending to wake up makes a difference in one's experiences at work.
Index Keywords: Collaborative action researches; Wake up

Title: The dream of pharmaceutical care: The role of emotion in galvanizing the rank and file
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Beyond cognition: How multiple embeddedness can facilitate the implementation of institutional change
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Disharmony in new harmony: Insights from the narcissistic leadership of robert owen
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Don't talk to strangers? Technology-enabled relational strategies and value creation
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Does one size fit all? How high commitment systems impact effectiveness of work-family practices
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015

Title: Minority sellers and pricing in the champagne industry: The case of female grape growers
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We examine how minority-majority group dynamics among sellers affect prices in the Champagne grape market. Female growers, a minority in this community, extract higher prices from buyers than male growers. This is because they get together to remedy their isolation, thus developing different price-setting norms and exchanging private information.
Index Keywords: Group dynamics; Price setting; Private information; Costs

Title: The imprinting effects of family founders, economic shocks and institutional development on firm internationalization
Source title: 75th Annual Meeting of the Academy of Management, AOM 2015
Abstract: We show that internationalization is contingent on the interplay between the economic and institutional environments during firm foundation, and the identity of firm founders. We find that family firms are more likely to internationalize if founded in less munificent economic and institutional environments, demonstrating the importance of imprinting effects.
Index Keywords: Family firms; Imprinting effects; Institutional development; Internationalisation
